intro: Scrotochloa, commonly known as the blue-eyed grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow leaves and small, clustered flowers that often have a blue or purple hue. The plant is native to various regions in the Americas and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Scrotochloa species are typically perennial and can be found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
